entries.title: 2K warns users their info has been stolen following breach of its help desk
entries.description: Stolen data includes names, email addresses, console IDs, and gamertags.

entries.title: Valve’s Steam Deck and official dock are widely available for the first time
entries.description: Plus, SteamOS 3.3.2 claims to improve the experience with third-party docks.

entries.title: Boston Dynamics *really* does not want you to add weapons to its robots
entries.description: Open letter cites concerns about misuse of "widely available" commercial robots among the public.

entries.title: Roblox sued for allegedly enabling young girl’s sexual, financial exploitation
entries.description: Meta, Snap, and Discord are also defendants in the lawsuit.

entries.title: The Super Mario Bros. Movie trailer is out, and it looks pretty solid
entries.description: Illumination's changes to familiar Mushroom Kingdom characters are finally confirmed.

entries.title: Biden pardons all federal simple marijuana possession offenses
entries.description: The criminalization of marijuana is a "failed approach," Biden said.

entries.title: Musk asks judge to cancel trial, claims Twitter won’t “take yes for an answer”
entries.description: Musk urges judge to stay case and remove October 17 trial from court's calendar.

entries.title: Linux kernel 5.19.2 code could cause permanent damage to some laptop displays
entries.description: Power sequence bugs cause damaging flickers on built-in displays. Update now.

entries.title: Adafruit’s Cheekmate gets to the bottom (ahem) of chess cheating controversy
entries.description: Adafruit tested its wireless haptic communication system with a juicy slab of pork butt.

entries.title: $250 Lego foosball table includes a whopping 22 minifigs, actually works
entries.description: Table Football set includes a handy, if macabre, compartment for extra heads.

entries.title: Blizzard scales back Overwatch 2’s controversial phone number requirement
entries.description: Those who have linked a Battle.net account can now avoid the "SMS Protect" system.

entries.title: Google shows off the Pixel Tablet dock—it doubles as a smart display
entries.description: The hardware looks just like a smart display, but the software is different.

entries.title: This car company set new track records to prove its 3D printing tech
entries.description: Kevin and Lukas Czinger have a new way of making cars, and it's starting to catch on.

entries.title: Twitter seeks assurances that Musk won’t break merger agreement again
entries.description: Debt financing a key sticking point in talks to end litigation and finish merger.

entries.title: Ex-Uber security chief convicted of hiding hack from federal regulators
entries.description: Former security chief may be first exec found guilty of hiding a data breach.

entries.title: The Pixel Watch is official: $349, good looks, and a four-year-old SoC
entries.description: Google prices itself way above Apple and Samsung, with slower hardware.

entries.title: Google’s Pixel 7 is official, with wider 17-country rollout
entries.description: They get aluminum camera bars and a "gen 2" Tensor chip that hasn't changed much.

entries.title: IoT harmony? What Matter and Thread really mean for your smart home
entries.description: An explainer on how Matter and Thread work and how they might actually help.

entries.title: The robot takeout revolution is closer than you think
entries.description: I learned a lot ordering a donut and a muffin from delivery robots.

entries.title: Why Big Tech shreds millions of storage devices it could reuse
entries.description: There are better options than destroying used hard drives in the name of data security.

entries.title: A bold effort to cure HIV—using Crispr
entries.description: Key is whether the gene-editing technology can stop the virus from replicating.
